newsitem.title: USA: Aviva sets sale of U.S. onshore properties.
newsitem.headline: Aviva sets sale of U.S. onshore properties.

text.p: Aviva Petroleum Inc said it has agreed to sell, effective October 1, all of its remaining United States onshore oil and natural gas properties for $3,000,000 in cash, subject to adjustments at closing which is expected to occur by December 23.
The bulk of the proceeds will be used to reduce bank debt, with the remainder added to working capital, Aviva said.

It said this sale concludes the rationalization of assets acquired by the company through acquisitions in 1989 and 1990. The company's remaining U.S. oil and natural gas properties are now offshore Louisiana, at Breton Sound and Main Pass, both of which are operated by the Aviva, it said.

The properties sold comprise some 350 wells located primarily in Pennsylvania, Oklahoma and Wyoming. During 1995, daily production averaged 64 barrels of oil and 2.3 million cubic feet of natural gas per day, net to the company's interest, representing about 4 percent and 72 percent, respectively, of its total production.
For 1995, revenue and pre-tax loss attributable to these properties were $1,740,000 and $160,000, respectively.
